servinfo.title: Maintenance Schedule under Normal Driving Conditions (Petrol Engine Model)

item.ptxt: This interval should be judged by odometer reading or months, whichever comes first.
This table includes service as scheduled up to 90,000 km (54,000 miles) mileage. Beyond 90,000 km (54,000 miles), carry out the same services at the same intervals respectively.
This table shows the typical maintenance schedule.
The actual maintenance schedule, however, varies depending on vehicle specifications and such typical maintenance schedule may not be applicable to some models.
Therefore, for the maintenance schedule specifically applicable to the vehicle being serviced, follow instructions in the “Periodic Maintenance Schedule” section of the Owner’s Manual.

entry.ptxt: M16A, J20A and J24B (market code E50 model) engine
J24B engine (other than market code E50 model)
SUZUKI long life coolant (Standard) (coolant color: Green)
SUZUKI super long life coolant (coolant color: Blue) #1
First time only: Replace at 150,000 km (90,000 miles) or 90 months Second time and after: Replace every 75,000 km (45,000 miles) or 45 months
Vehicle with A/F sensor and/or O2 sensor
Iridium Plug or Platinum Plug (N32A engine)
Replace every 105,000 km (63,000 miles) or 84 months
Vehicle without A/F sensor and O2 sensor
When leaded fuel is used, refer to Maintenance Recommended under Severe Driving Conditions (Petrol Engine Model) .
Refer to Maintenance Recommended under Severe Driving Conditions (Petrol Engine Model) .
Vehicle with A/F sensor and/or O2 sensor
Vehicle without A/F sensor and O2 sensor
Vehicle with A/F sensor and/or O2 sensor
Vehicle without A/F sensor and O2 sensor

Brake discs and pads (thickness, wear, damage) (I:
)

Brake drums and shoes (wear, damage) (Rear drum brake model) (I:
)

Brake hoses and pipes (leakage, damage, clamp) (I:
)

Brake lever and cable (damage, stroke, operation) (I:
)
Inspect at first 15,000 km (9,000 miles only)

item.ptxt: “I”: Inspect and correct, replace or lubricate if necessary
#1: If SUZUKI super long life coolant (coolant color: Blue) is replaced with the other coolant, follow schedule of SUZUKI long life coolant (standard) (coolant color: Green).
If SUZUKI long life coolant (standard) is replaced with SUZUKI super long life coolant, follow schedule of SUZUKI super long life coolant.
For Sweden, items with asterisk (*) should be performed by odometer reading only.
For spark plugs, replace every 50,000 km if the local law requires.
Use only specified spark plug. For detail, refer to “Spark Plug Inspection” as follows.
